content:
Globálna databáza je indexovací systém umožňujúcí Thunderbirdu vyhľadávať v zprávach. Znovuvytvorenie globálnej databázy preindexuje správy a vizitky z adresára. (Správy z konferencií nie sú indexované.)

Postup znovuvytvorenia globálnej databázy: - Ukončite Thunderbird. - Vyhľadajte vo svojom profile Thunderbirdu súbor global-messages-db.sqlite - Odstráňte tento súbor. - Spustite Thunderbird. Automaticky sa začne proces vytvárania indexu. V závislosti na počte správ môže indexácia trvať dosť dlhý čas (cca 5 minút). Počas indexácie môžete Thunderbird používat, iba bude znížený jeho výkon a vyhľadávania prinesú iba čiastočné výsledky, alebo dokonca žiadne. Proces indexácie môžete sledovať v Správcovi aktivít (ponuka Nástroje > Správca činnosti).
creator: Ansamb

content:
Il problema è il certificato del sito. Può darsi sia cambiato l'hosting del sito o che il vecchio certificato vada aggiornato. È comunque qualcosa che devi chiedere a chi amministra quel server di posta.

Un'altra ipotesi è che il certificato non venga riconosciuto per l'interferenza di un software terzo, ad esempio un antivirus con controllo delle connessione.
creator: @next

content:
Dat is vervelend. U kunt een of meerdere van de volgende stappen overwegen:

  1. Werk Thunderbird bij: zorg ervoor dat u de nieuwste versie van Thunderbird gebruikt, omdat updates vaak prestatieverbeteringen en bugfixes bevatten.
  2. Start in Probleemoplossingsmodus: start Thunderbird in de Probleemoplossingsmodus om te zien of het probleem aanhoudt. Als de prestaties verbeteren, kan het probleem te maken hebben met add-ons of thema’s. Voer in dat geval de volgende stap uit.
  3. Schakel add-ons en thema’s uit: schakel alle add-ons en thema’s uit en schakel ze vervolgens één voor één weer in om te identificeren welke mogelijk het probleem veroorzaken.
  4. Controleer antivirussoftware: soms kan antivirussoftware conflicteren met Thunderbird. Probeer uw antivirus tijdelijk uit te schakelen om te zien of dit de prestaties verbetert.
  5. Verminder mapgrootte: grote mappen kunnen Thunderbird vertragen. Archiveer oude e-mailberichten en houd uw Postvak IN en andere mappen zo klein mogelijk.
  6. Bouw de globale database opnieuw op: het herbouwen van de globale database kan helpen als het probleem te maken heeft met beschadigde databasebestanden. Om dit te doen, zoek en verwijder het bestand ‘global-messages-db.sqlite’ in uw Thunderbird-profiel.
  7. Controleer achtergrondprocessen: zorg ervoor dat er geen andere zware processen op de achtergrond draaien die de prestaties van Thunderbird kunnen beïnvloeden.
  8. Optimaliseer systeemprestaties: algemeen systeemonderhoud, zoals het bijwerken van uw besturingssysteem, het vrijmaken van schijfruimte en het vergroten van het RAM-geheugen, kan ook helpen om de prestaties van Thunderbird te verbeteren.

Laat het ons weten als u verdere hulp nodig hebt!
creator: markh2

content: What you are describing is that your phone and your PC are in sync. That is intentional. That lets you see and respond whether on phone or PC. You can reset your phone from an IMAP account to a POP account, but you would also need to set account to leave messages on server. Sent messages would stay on the phone and not appear on the pc. I don't recommend this, but that setting may work for you.

content:
Sent mail is a bit confusing with gmail. If you have gmail in TB, messages sent from TB are automatically copied to the Sent Mail folder, so this is the folder that should be subscribed (IMAP). Also, because they are copied automatically, uncheck 'Place a copy in' in Account Settings, Copies & Folders.

In gmail webmail, messages sent from there are copied to the Sent folder. They will appear in Sent Mail in TB, and the messages in TB's Sent Mail folder appear in the gmail webmail Sent folder. It works the same with the gmail Android app.

content:
re :On the following screenshot, we can see that 2025 is missing in the year chart.

The block for 2025 will not appear if there are no matches for that year.

I'm not sure what you actually typed in the global search so I'm assuming it was an email address or did you type the display name as well eg: Name and then email address or just email address ?

If I type just an email address into the global search and select the first drop down option : Messages mentioning email address I see 'Results for: email address'

If I select the second option in drop down list which offers a Display name followed by an email address Then search says: Results for: involving email address. It sounds like you selected the second option in list as 'concernant' translates to 'involving' in English.

Try again but this time only type the email address in search and select the first option - messages mentioning email address. It is possible the display name has altered or was not included in emails received in 2025, so they were not displayed.

If you had type a name then perhaps that exact name you typed is not actually included with more recent emails received but was included in previous emails.

content:
Is this a Pop mail account or an Imap mail account ?

All mail gets received into Inbox - then I'm presuming you have created a filter which auto moves specific email to Junk or maybe you manually set an email as junk and it gets put into junk. However, there is still the original copy in the Inbox folder - it gets marked as deleted and hidden. When you compact the folder it gets properly deleted from the Inbox. This is a housekeeping clean up process to keep files tidy and reduce size. It also means files are less prone to corruption.

You would need to let us know what issue you were having with junk filter. Are you talking about the inbuilt Junk Settings or a message filter you created.

It would be helpful to see an image of your Account Settings > Junk Settings for the account. If you created a Message Filter then please post image of that filter as well.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Thank you, I think I should NOT have mentioned Junk as that's not really part of the problem.  :-)

This is a POP3 account, not IMAP.

I have multiple filters setup in Tools>Message Filters. It filters all my various business email into various folders I have created. About 4 send email to custom folders. I've attached a filter screenshot.

If compacting the folder gets rid of these FILTERED hidden emails, is there a way to automate that? Is there a setting somewhere that will ensure that moved really means moved?

Thanks so much for the help!

content:
Here is a way to let thunderbird update profiles.ini for you. These steps are because you COPYed the profile to D, meaing it is now in both places.

  1. click help>troubleshootinginformation
  2. scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles'
  3. click the 'create profile' button
  4. click next
  5. enter a shorthand name for profile, such as, PROFILED
  6. now, click the 'choose' button and locate and select the profile on D
  7. now, select finish and launch
  8. after confirming that all is well, you can safely delete the profile on drive C.

IF you no longer have a profile on C, then do this:

  1. click windows key and 'r' key on desktop
  2. enter thunderbird.exe -p in the window
  3. click the 'create' button and proceed as above.

content:
My email server is going from POP3 to IMAP and I need to save my old emails and folders.

What does "save my old emails and folders" mean exactly? Emails and folders are on your computer already. Are backing them up? If so, how is that a problem?

I still have another 18.2GB to go.

To go from where to where?

The new account has the same name.

Account names need to be unique in Thunderbird.

Is there any other way to save these emails and still have them available?

Again, they are on your computer already. For the time being just leave them alone, and don't mess with your existing POP account.

Once the IMAP access to the server is available set up a new IMAP account in Thunderbird for the new server, and give it a unique name. If you left your messages on the POP server, they'd be available via IMAP right away. Of course this assumes your email provider makes them available on the new server. Otherwise you can upload them to the IMAP server once the new account is functional.

Having said that, it's always recommended to have a recent backup of your Thunderbird profile. https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data#w_backing-up-a-profile
creator: christ1

content:
There are a multitude of issues why TB seems to be the culprit...

...a little while ago, I was helping someone to understand about the security of a server and the need for it to have a valid certificate to protect the user's computer from an insecure connection.

Under that circumstance, TB simply wouldn't connect but informed the user about the problem. It 'hanged'. None of us would want TB to connect to an insecure and unvalidated Server and put the user at risk.

TB is doing it's job in a great many of these instances. Other times, it isn't TB that's doing anything wrong. Trying to work out what the problem is takes time and the volunteer advisers here have to work out where the problem is before offering a solution.
creator: frisée
